answer:
Tips for locating immunization records are here. BC has a routine immunization schedule for adults not immunized in childhood and these vaccines are publicly funded (free). You can receive vaccines from your local health unit, most pharmacies and some doctors' offices. Services vary in BC.
You may also need other vaccines as an adult depending on your age, health conditions, job, lifestyle, travel plans and the vaccines you received in the past. Some are provided for free, and others may need to be purchased.
Immunization Nurse
question: My mother was a €˜conscious objector' re: immunization so I had spotty vaccinations. I was born in 1962 and remember having a shot in grade 2 and in high school. Thanks,
